thread.title: Frazier shines again in UGA's narrow win over LSU
thread.title_full: Frazier shines again in UGA's narrow win over LSU

title: Frazier shines again in UGA's narrow win over LSU
text:
Frazier shines again in UGA's narrow win over LSU Senior guard J.J. Frazier had yet another big performance as Georgia took down LSU on Saturday. Slot to Georgia Links 
ATHENS, Ga. -- Georgia (17-12) needed every one of J.J. Frazier's 29 points as it pulled its SEC record to .500 at 8-8 with an 82-80 win over LSU. The senior guard scored at least 28 points for the fourth time in his last five games and has the go-ahead free throws with 1.6 remaining to give the Bulldogs a much-needed win. 
He also added eight assists and was joined by Juwan Parker and Derek Ogbeide as double-digit scorers. Parker had 12 points and a game-high eight rebounds. Ogbeide also had 12 points and had four boards. (Photo: UGA Athletics: John Kelley) Not a member? Try a seven-day FREE trial to VIP access to Dawgs247! 
The Bulldogs led by as many as 17 in the first half but the Tigers got hot in the second period and out rebounded the Bulldogs 34-29 for the game. 
Still, Georgia led for 33 minutes and 49 seconds of the contest and had a six-point advantage with less than five minutes left. That evaporated quickly, however, and LSU took a three-point lead with a 9-0 run and just under a minute left. 
Georgia will look to make it three-straight against Auburn on Wednesday, March 1 at Stegeman Coliseum. Tip is set for 6:30 p.m. ET. Author
